title: Erigon Node stuck at 0x103663f
body:
Hey ,Bros, 
    I 'm newer for ergion , not sure I'm correct or not .
    I 'm running a node on AWS t2.xLarge with 4t disk , 16g ram  
    it had been syncing a few days about 15 days , a bit slow but working  
      but yesterday it stuck at 0x103663f block number ; 
      some friends told me it need to be unwind ,and restart at block number not with end of 9 , I tried 
      but still failed .
      could you guys take a look ? 
      much appreciated
Log:

or add --internalcl or use external CL

Thank you  , @AskAlexSharov , right now , Started Ethereum 2.0 Gossip Service 
```Jul 19 07:34:17 ip-10-0-0-232 erigon[352868]: [INFO] [07-19|07:34:17.270] [Caplin] P2P                             peers=0
Jul 19 07:34:48 ip-10-0-0-232 erigon[352868]: [INFO] [07-19|07:34:48.333] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth68=39 eth67=4

``` 
I'm just waiting peers coming , right ?
@AskAlexSharov Bro , [Caplin] P2P peers=0 still 0 , it's running on AWS , any investigation can help here ?

i don't know. can:
- check firewaless: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon#default-ports-and-firewalls
- increase logs verbosity
- upgrade
- use external CL
Thank you @AskAlexSharov , it works when I switched to external CL .
Stuck at the block and restarts a few times but my caplin says it has more than 20 peers. Will try an external CL...
